text: well I've been involved in it for a very
long time and interested in it I think
as a child I became interested in these
issues um what I I studied agricultural
economics which I thought had a
connection to to this I had the
opportunity in my late 20s to go and
work in Africa for three years which I
did in in uh the Ivory Coast in Malawi
uh and then even though subsequently I
was working in the in the public service
in in Ireland and in at European level
uh when an opportunity came to to work
with concern uh some seven years ago I I
took it because I mean concern is a is
in my view a great organization and it
was an opportunity to to come in as
chief executive and and I think it was
it's been a wonderful seven years and uh
I've really enjoyed it and I think we've
achieved a great deal over those
period we work in almost 30 countries
almost 20 of those are in Africa uh the
B the rest in Asia apart from Haiti
which is uh the only country outside of
Africa and Asia we work in um we deal in
both emergency response and in long-term
development work uh and we're we're
particularly involved in the whole area
of of Health Food security improving
livelihoods um education and HIV
AIDS I think human rights is you know at
the foundation of of of development work
I mean at the end of the day uh people
have a right to food they have a right
to water they have a right to the very
basic the existent the the they have a
right to all the things that we take for
granted as rights in in these count and
I think that has to be uh the foundation
stone of of where of how people go about
now you know how that's expressed in
different countries will depend depend
on the political climate there I mean
concern doesn't always
trumpet the human rights
agenda because the sort of many of the
countries we're working in if we were to
do that our practical Effectiveness on
the ground
could well be
compromised but what we what we do in
our work day in and day out is
absolutely trying to vindicate the human
rights of the very poorest people and in
my view that is what you know we will be
continuing to do for for many years to
come
